title: Intermittent Google problem with Firefox
content:
Am using Firefox 94.0.1 on Mac OS 10.15.7. Ever since most recent update, any and all Google related websites will randomly fail to load UNLESS I use a private browsing window. As in you type google.com one minute and it loads, but 15 minutes later it does not â€” the little "loading the page" dot in the tab bounces back and forth forever, and you don't even get an error message. Ditto for any embedded search engines or map viewers and Google Docs.

I have completely nuked the cache and the problem has persisted. I am not signed into a firefox account to do any syncing. I would reinstall firefox, but I work at a company that has all the computers so locked down that installing anything is impossible. Google Chrome works fine. I use Firefox at home with the same OS and it works fine.

Suggestions? Using private browsing mode for everything is getting really annoying.
creator: kevinyma

title: Colorways
content: Every time I open Firefox, I'm asked to explore Colorways. I'm now tired of this game. How do I go back to normal?
creator: kevinalee27

title: Move profile "Storage" folder
content:
When I looked into why it was taking so long to backup my FF profile, I realized it was because their are over 21k files my backup software has to compare.

The majority of these are in the "Storage" folder -- apparently local/offline storage for various sites.

I've already moved the cache to a non-synced location using browser.cache.disk.parent_directory and would like to do the same with "Storage".

But I can't seem to find any info on what pref would allow me to do that. Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.
creator: cweinhofer

title: FireFox won't recognize my YubiKey
content: I use YubiKey for several Google accounts and Facebook. Firefox suddenly refuse to recognize my YubiKey. It keep saying it is not familiar with the key. However, the key does work with Facebook and one of my Google account. At this point, I still can use other 2FA method to get in for mail/calendar function only. If any of one encountered something similar, would you please kindly advise. Thanks, Howard p.s. I attached a snip shot with this message as well
creator: hhc1218
